page.title: 13St Michaels Church Braintree
page.content: St. Michael's Church stands at the corner of South Street and High Street. It is the local parish Church. It was originally built just after the town moved to the crossroads from its old site by the river. An area of land from the Church burial ground was taken for house building in High Street at the end of the 15th century. Certain of the pews in the church were held by rich families of the town and surrounding areas. It was during this period that much building of ornate figures took place. The modern church gives services on a regular basis and these are generally timed to serve the whole community. Throughout the course of a year many people pass through the doors of this beautiful establishment.
